definitions.definition: a person who is in charge of running a business, a shop or a similar organization or part of one

examples.text: I'm a **senior manager** in a multinational company.
If you have any questions, speak to your manager.
He has been promoted to business development manager.
It helps to have a sympathetic manager.
Last month she was named manager of the new unit.
They hired a new campaign manager.
Your job will be to assist the production manager.

definitions.definition: a person who deals with the business affairs of an actor, a musician, etc.

examples.text: The comedian is unavailable for comment, according to her manager.
The band's manager said that the gig sold out in hours.

definitions.definition: a person who trains and organizes a sports team

examples.text: He will be the club's caretaker manager until a new manager is appointed.

definitions.definition: a person who is good at managing resources

examples.text: She's a good manager who never throws any food away.
TV ads depicted the candidate as a would-be efficient manager of the US economy.
